Content:
Vidmerger

A wrapper around FFmpeg which simplifies merging of multiple videos.

![demo.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/main/img/demo.png) ## üôâ What is this exactly? Vidmerger is a command-line-tool which uses **ffmpeg** to merge multiple video-files with the same file-extension into one file, for example running `vidmerger .` on mp4 files would create a merged video called `output.mp4` üê£ Here is the usage help of vidmerger ü§ó
Translation:
Vidmerger

A wrapper around FFmpeg which simplifies merging of multiple videos.

![demo.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/main/img/demo.png) ## üôâ What is this exactly? Vidmerger is a command-line tool that uses **ffmpeg** to merge multiple video files with the same file extension into one file, for example running `vidmerger .` on mp4 files would create a merged video called `output.mp4` üê£ Here is the usage help of vidmerger ü§ó

RowTranslations.originContent: A wrapper around FFmpeg which simplifies merging of multiple videos.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: A wrapper around FFmpeg which simplifies merging of multiple videos.

RowTranslations.originContent: Vidmerger is a command-line-tool which uses **ffmpeg** to merge multiple video-files with the same file-extension into one file, for example running `vidmerger .` on mp4 files would create a merged video called `output.mp4` üê£
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Vidmerger is a command-line tool that uses **ffmpeg** to merge multiple video files with the same file extension into one file, for example running `vidmerger .` on mp4 files would create a merged video called `output.mp4` üê£

RowTranslations.originContent: Here is the usage help of vidmerger ü§ó
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Here is the usage help of vidmerger ü§ó

Content:
```shell
A wrapper around ffmpeg which simplifies merging multiple videos üéû  Everything in between the first `-` till the fill extension of the input files will be used as chapter titles üìñ.

Usage: vidmerger [OPTIONS] <TARGET_DIR>

Arguments:
  <TARGET_DIR>  Sets the input file to use

Options:
  -f, --format <format>   Specifies which formats should be merged individually, the default is üëâ 3g2,3gp,aac,ac3,alac,amr,ape,au,avi,awb,dts,f4a,f4b,f4p,f4v,flac,flv,m4a,m4b,m4p,m4r,m4v,mkv,mov,mp2,mp3,mp4,mpeg,mpg,oga,ogg,ogm,ogv,ogx,opus,pcm,spx,wav,webm,wma,wmv
      --fps <fps>         Generates videos inside a temporary folder with this fps value and merges them
      --shutdown          For doing a shutdown at the end (needs sudo)
      --skip-fps-changer  Skips the fps changer
  -y, --yes               Skips confirmation of merge order
      --verbose           Prints detailed logs
  -h, --help              Print help
  -V, --version           Print version
```
Translation:
```shell
A wrapper around ffmpeg which simplifies merging multiple videos üéû  Everything in between the first `-` till the fill extension of the input files will be used as chapter titles üìñ.

Usage: vidmerger [OPTIONS] <TARGET_DIR>

Arguments:
  <TARGET_DIR>  Sets the input file to use

Options:
  -f, --format <format>   Specifies which formats should be merged individually, the default is üëâ 3g2,3gp,aac,ac3,alac,amr,ape,au,avi,awb,dts,f4a,f4b,f4p,f4v,flac,flv,m4a,m4b,m4p,m4r,m4v,mkv,mov,mp2,mp3,mp4,mpeg,mpg,oga,ogg,ogm,ogv,ogx,opus,pcm,spx,wav,webm,wma,wmv
      --fps <fps>         Generates videos inside a temporary folder with this fps value and merges them
      --shutdown          For doing a shutdown at the end (needs sudo)
      --skip-fps-changer  Skips the fps changer
  -y, --yes               Skips confirmation of merge order
      --verbose           Prints detailed logs
  -h, --help              Print help
  -V, --version           Print version
```

Content:
| Feature | Description | | :---------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Selector | Iterates through [this list of file endings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/main/src/main.rs#L34), selects all files which matches with the current file ending except ones which start with a dot. The list can be overwritten by `--format` or `-f`, example: `--format mp4,mkv`. | | FPS_Changer | After detecting not matching fps values, it scales all the higher fps videos down to the lowest detecting fps value. Can be skipped by `--skip-fps-changer`. The desired fps value can be set by `--fps`, example: `--fps 23.976`. | | Merger | Finally, it merges the videos and adds chapters. Chapter titles are automatically extracted from the input file names ‚Äî specifically, the text between the first dash and the file extension. Example: `Video_A - Chapter 1.mp4`. | ## ‚ú® Installing / Getting started You can install it on all the three major operating systems ü§ó ### X64 | Platform | Packager | Command | | :-------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | üçé MacOS | üç∫ [Homwbrew](https://github.com/TGotwig/homebrew-vidmerger/blob/master/vidmerger.rb) | brew tap tgotwig/vidmerger
brew install vidmerger | | üêß Linux | üç∫ [Homwbrew](https://github.com/TGotwig/homebrew-linux-vidmerger/blob/master/vidmerger.rb) | brew tap tgotwig/linux-vidmerger
brew install vidmerger | | üêß Linux | üç∫ CURL | sudo curl -L https://github.com/TGotwig/vidmerger/releases/latest/download/vidmerger-linux.tar.gz -o /tmp/vidmerger-linux.tar.gz && sudo tar -xzvf /tmp/vidmerger-linux.tar.gz -C /usr/local/bin | | üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà Windows | üç´ [Chocolatey](https://community.chocolatey.org/packages/vidmerger) | choco install ffmpeg # prerequisite
choco install vidmerger | ### ARM64 | Platform | Packager | Command | | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | üçé MacOS | üç∫ [Homwbrew](https://github.com/TGotwig/homebrew-vidmerger/blob/master/vidmerger.rb) | brew tap tgotwig/vidmerger
brew install vidmerger | | üêß Linux | üç∫ CURL | sudo curl -L https://github.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/releases/download/0.4.0/vidmerger-linux-arm64.tar.gz -o /tmp/vidmerger-linux-arm64.tar.gz && sudo tar -xzvf /tmp/vidmerger-linux-arm64.tar.gz -C /usr/local/bin | ### Docker (X64 & ARM64) You can also use Docker to run vidmerger without installing anything except Docker, hosted on [Dockerhub](https://hub.docker.com/r/tgotwig/vidmerger) üê≥

The list can be overwritten by `--format` or `-f`, example: `--format mp4,mkv`. | | FPS_Changer | After detecting not matching fps values, it scales all the higher fps videos down to the lowest detecting fps value. Content:
```bash
docker container run tgotwig/vidmerger --help
docker container run tgotwig/vidmerger --version
docker container run -it -v ./data/call_merger:/data tgotwig/vidmerger
```
Translation:
```bash
docker container run tgotwig/vidmerger --help
docker container run tgotwig/vidmerger --version
docker container run -it -v ./data/call_merger:/data tgotwig/vidmerger
```

Content:
## ‚öôÔ∏è Developing

The primary requirements are rust, ffmpeg, and go-task. The devcontainer provides all necessary components üîß

If you see anything to improve, just create an [issue](https://github.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/issues) or directly open a [pull request](https://github.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/pulls) ü§ó‚ú®

### Deploying / Publishing

For details on how to publish a new version, you can look up the [Publish new version](https://github.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/wiki#-publish-new-version) wiki page üìñ

## üß™ Tests

- For major tests: `task test`
- For linting tests: `task lint`

## üåü Style guide

- [rust-clippy](rust-clippy)
- [rls-vscode](https://github.com/rust-lang/rls-vscode)
Translation:

The primary requirements are rust, ffmpeg, and go-task. The devcontainer provides all necessary components üîß

If you see anything to improve, just create an [issue](https://github.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/issues) or directly open a [pull request](https://github.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/pulls) ü§ó‚ú®

### Deploying / Publishing

For details on how to publish a new version, you can look up the [Publish new version](https://github.com/tgotwig/vidmerger/wiki#-publish-new-version) wiki page üìñ

## üß™ Tests

- For major tests: `task test`
- For linting tests: `task lint`

## üåü Style guide

- [rust-clippy](rust-clippy)
- [rls-vscode](https://github.com/rust-lang/rls-vscode)
